title: How to Make Greek Watermelon Salad

steps.headline: Cube the watermelon.
steps.description: Wash a large watermelon and cut it in half. Wrap up one half of the watermelon and store it in the fridge to eat later. Use a knife to carefully carve away the rind and outer skin of the other watermelon half so that you are left with the red fruit. Then cut the watermelon into 1 inch (2.54 cm) cubes. Measure the cubes in large measuring cup and make sure you have 3 cups. If you don’t have enough watermelon, use part of the remaining watermelon half. If you have too much, wrap up the extra and store it for later.

steps.headline: Chop the tomato and onion.
steps.description: Wash the two tomatoes and chop them into approximately 1 inch (2.54) pieces. Then peel the onion and slice it into very thin strips that are about 2 inches (5.08 cm) long.

steps.headline: Peel and slice the cucumber.
steps.description: Wash the cucumber and use a vegetable peeler to remove the skin. Cut the cucumber in half lengthwise, then cut it again lengthwise so it is divided into four long quarters. Use a small paring knife to cut away the seeded sections of quarter, then chop the cucumber into pieces that are about ½ inch (1.27 cm) long.

steps.headline: Chop the parsley and mint.
steps.description: Wash the parsley and mint sprigs, then use a knife to cut away the stems and branches away so that you are left with just the leaves. Roughly chop the parsley and mint leaves and set them aside.

steps.headline: Combine the chopped ingredients and feta.
steps.description: Place the chopped watermelon, tomatoes, cucumber and onion in a large bowl along with the pitted kalamata olives. If the feta cheese is not already crumbled, crumble it in large chunks into the bowl.

steps.headline: Add the herbs and mix.
steps.description: Place the chopped parsley and mint into the bowl of chopped vegetables and feta and use a large spoon to mix all the ingredients together until they are combined.

steps.headline: Dress the salad and serve it cool.
steps.description: Combine the olive oil and red wine vinegar in a small jar or salad dressing pitcher, then pour it over the salad. Sprinkle on a pinch of salt and pepper and serve the salad while it’s still cool.

methods.name: Preparing Greek Watermelon Salad With Couscous

steps.headline: Bring couscous to a boil.
steps.description: Place the couscous and the 2 cups (473.17 ml) of water in a medium sized pot or saucepan over medium-high heat. Cook until the mixture reaches a boil, about 10 minutes.

steps.headline: Let the couscous sit covered for 5-10 minutes.
steps.description: After taking the couscous off the heat, place the lid on the pot and let the couscous sit for 5-10 minutes. Check the couscous after 5 minutes. If it has absorbed all the water in the pot, remove the lid and let it cool. If there is still water in the pan, check every minute or so until the water is absorbed.

steps.headline: Cube the watermelon.
steps.description: Wash a large watermelon and cut it in half. Cut the rind and outer skin off of one watermelon half so you are left with the fruit of the melon. Then cut the fruit into 1 inch (2.54) cubes.

steps.headline: Cut the cucumber.
steps.description: Wash and peel the cucumber with a vegetable peeler. Cut the cucumber in half lengthwise, then cut again into fourths. Use a small knife to cut out the seed portion of the cucumber, then cut the cucumber into ½ inch pieces

steps.headline: Dice the shallot and slice the olives.
steps.description: Peel away the papery layers from the shallot, then use a small knife to finely dice the shallot into fine pieces. Then take all of the kalamata olives and slice them in half.

steps.headline: Mix the watermelon, feta and cucumber.
steps.description: Place the chopped watermelon and cucumber into a large mixing bowl. Add the feta cheese to the bowl and then use a large spoon to mix all the ingredients.

steps.headline: Add the couscous and mix.
steps.description: Once the couscous has cooled, use a fork to fluff it up, then scoop it into the mixing bowl. Mix it thoroughly in with the other ingredients until the mixture is homogenous.

steps.headline: Make and add the vinaigrette.
steps.description: Combine the diced shallot, red wine vinegar and olive oil into a small bowl, then pour the vinaigrette over the couscous watermelon salad to dress it. Garnish the salad with mint if you wish and serve either cold or at room temperature.

methods.name: Making Greek Watermelon Salad With Orange Vinaigrette

steps.headline: Cut the watermelon into cubes.
steps.description: Wash the watermelon and cut it in half. Cut away the rind of one half of the watermelon so you are left with the red fruit. Then cut the fruit into 1 inch (2.54 cm) cubes.

steps.headline: Cut the feta cheese.
steps.description: Take the block of feta cheese and dice it into pieces that are about ½ inch thick (1.27 cm). You can also use feta cheese in large crumbles if you don’t have access to blocked feta cheese.

steps.headline: Make the vinaigrette.
steps.description: Mix the orange juice and balsamic vinaigrette in a small salad dressing pitcher along with a pinch of salt and pepper. Then add the olive oil and mix.

steps.headline: Mix the ingredients together.
steps.description: Place the watermelon and feta cheese in a large bowl and mix. Then pour on the vinaigrette over the salad and garnish with shredded mint leaves. Serve the salad while cold.

text: Making Traditional Greek Watermelon Salad Cube the watermelon. Wash a large watermelon and cut it in half. Wrap up one half of the watermelon and store it in the fridge to eat later. Use a knife to carefully carve away the rind and outer skin of the other watermelon half so that you are left with the red fruit. Then cut the watermelon into 1 inch (2.54 cm) cubes. Measure the cubes in large measuring cup and make sure you have 3 cups. If you don’t have enough watermelon, use part of the remaining watermelon half. If you have too much, wrap up the extra and store it for later. Chop the tomato and onion. Wash the two tomatoes and chop them into approximately 1 inch (2.54) pieces. Then peel the onion and slice it into very thin strips that are about 2 inches (5.08 cm) long. Peel and slice the cucumber. Wash the cucumber and use a vegetable peeler to remove the skin. Cut the cucumber in half lengthwise, then cut it again lengthwise so it is divided into four long quarters. Use a small paring knife to cut away the seeded sections of quarter, then chop the cucumber into pieces that are about ½ inch (1.27 cm) long. Chop the parsley and mint. Wash the parsley and mint sprigs, then use a knife to cut away the stems and branches away so that you are left with just the leaves. Roughly chop the parsley and mint leaves and set them aside. Combine the chopped ingredients and feta. Place the chopped watermelon, tomatoes, cucumber and onion in a large bowl along with the pitted kalamata olives. If the feta cheese is not already crumbled, crumble it in large chunks into the bowl. Add the herbs and mix. Place the chopped parsley and mint into the bowl of chopped vegetables and feta and use a large spoon to mix all the ingredients together until they are combined. Dress the salad and serve it cool. Combine the olive oil and red wine vinegar in a small jar or salad dressing pitcher, then pour it over the salad. Sprinkle on a pinch of salt and pepper and serve the salad while it’s still cool. Preparing Greek Watermelon Salad With Couscous Bring couscous to a boil. Place the couscous and the 2 cups (473.17 ml) of water in a medium sized pot or saucepan over medium-high heat. Cook until the mixture reaches a boil, about 10 minutes. Let the couscous sit covered for 5-10 minutes. After taking the couscous off the heat, place the lid on the pot and let the couscous sit for 5-10 minutes. Check the couscous after 5 minutes. If it has absorbed all the water in the pot, remove the lid and let it cool. If there is still water in the pan, check every minute or so until the water is absorbed. Cube the watermelon. Wash a large watermelon and cut it in half. Cut the rind and outer skin off of one watermelon half so you are left with the fruit of the melon. Then cut the fruit into 1 inch (2.54) cubes. Cut the cucumber. Wash and peel the cucumber with a vegetable peeler. Cut the cucumber in half lengthwise, then cut again into fourths. Use a small knife to cut out the seed portion of the cucumber, then cut the cucumber into ½ inch pieces Dice the shallot and slice the olives. Peel away the papery layers from the shallot, then use a small knife to finely dice the shallot into fine pieces. Then take all of the kalamata olives and slice them in half. Mix the watermelon, feta and cucumber. Place the chopped watermelon and cucumber into a large mixing bowl. Add the feta cheese to the bowl and then use a large spoon to mix all the ingredients. Add the couscous and mix. Once the couscous has cooled, use a fork to fluff it up, then scoop it into the mixing bowl. Mix it thoroughly in with the other ingredients until the mixture is homogenous. Make and add the vinaigrette. Combine the diced shallot, red wine vinegar and olive oil into a small bowl, then pour the vinaigrette over the couscous watermelon salad to dress it. Garnish the salad with mint if you wish and serve either cold or at room temperature. Making Greek Watermelon Salad With Orange Vinaigrette Cut the watermelon into cubes. Wash the watermelon and cut it in half. Cut away the rind of one half of the watermelon so you are left with the red fruit. Then cut the fruit into 1 inch (2.54 cm) cubes. Cut the feta cheese. Take the block of feta cheese and dice it into pieces that are about ½ inch thick (1.27 cm). You can also use feta cheese in large crumbles if you don’t have access to blocked feta cheese. Make the vinaigrette. Mix the orange juice and balsamic vinaigrette in a small salad dressing pitcher along with a pinch of salt and pepper. Then add the olive oil and mix. Mix the ingredients together. Place the watermelon and feta cheese in a large bowl and mix. Then pour on the vinaigrette over the salad and garnish with shredded mint leaves. Serve the salad while cold. Finished.
sentences: Making Traditional Greek Watermelon Salad Cube the watermelon.
Wash a large watermelon and cut it in half.
Wrap up one half of the watermelon and store it in the fridge to eat later.
Use a knife to carefully carve away the rind and outer skin of the other watermelon half so that you are left with the red fruit.
Then cut the watermelon into 1 inch (2.54 cm) cubes.
Measure the cubes in large measuring cup and make sure you have 3 cups.
If you don’t have enough watermelon, use part of the remaining watermelon half.
If you have too much, wrap up the extra and store it for later.
Chop the tomato and onion.
Wash the two tomatoes and chop them into approximately 1 inch (2.54) pieces.
Then peel the onion and slice it into very thin strips that are about 2 inches (5.08 cm) long.
Peel and slice the cucumber.
Wash the cucumber and use a vegetable peeler to remove the skin.
Cut the cucumber in half lengthwise, then cut it again lengthwise so it is divided into four long quarters.
Use a small paring knife to cut away the seeded sections of quarter, then chop the cucumber into pieces that are about ½ inch (1.27 cm) long.
Chop the parsley and mint.
Wash the parsley and mint sprigs, then use a knife to cut away the stems and branches away so that you are left with just the leaves.
Roughly chop the parsley and mint leaves and set them aside.
Combine the chopped ingredients and feta.
Place the chopped watermelon, tomatoes, cucumber and onion in a large bowl along with the pitted kalamata olives.
If the feta cheese is not already crumbled, crumble it in large chunks into the bowl.
Add the herbs and mix.
Place the chopped parsley and mint into the bowl of chopped vegetables and feta and use a large spoon to mix all the ingredients together until they are combined.
Dress the salad and serve it cool.
Combine the olive oil and red wine vinegar in a small jar or salad dressing pitcher, then pour it over the salad.
Sprinkle on a pinch of salt and pepper and serve the salad while it’s still cool.
Preparing Greek Watermelon Salad With Couscous Bring couscous to a boil.
Place the couscous and the 2 cups (473.17 ml) of water in a medium sized pot or saucepan over medium-high heat.
Cook until the mixture reaches a boil, about 10 minutes.
Let the couscous sit covered for 5-10 minutes.
After taking the couscous off the heat, place the lid on the pot and let the couscous sit for 5-10 minutes.
Check the couscous after 5 minutes.
If it has absorbed all the water in the pot, remove the lid and let it cool.
If there is still water in the pan, check every minute or so until the water is absorbed.
Cube the watermelon.
Wash a large watermelon and cut it in half.
Cut the rind and outer skin off of one watermelon half so you are left with the fruit of the melon.
Then cut the fruit into 1 inch (2.54) cubes.
Cut the cucumber.
Wash and peel the cucumber with a vegetable peeler.
Cut the cucumber in half lengthwise, then cut again into fourths.
Use a small knife to cut out the seed portion of the cucumber, then cut the cucumber into ½ inch pieces Dice the shallot and slice the olives.
Peel away the papery layers from the shallot, then use a small knife to finely dice the shallot into fine pieces.
Then take all of the kalamata olives and slice them in half.
Mix the watermelon, feta and cucumber.
Place the chopped watermelon and cucumber into a large mixing bowl.
Add the feta cheese to the bowl and then use a large spoon to mix all the ingredients.
Add the couscous and mix.
Once the couscous has cooled, use a fork to fluff it up, then scoop it into the mixing bowl.
Mix it thoroughly in with the other ingredients until the mixture is homogenous.
Make and add the vinaigrette.
Combine the diced shallot, red wine vinegar and olive oil into a small bowl, then pour the vinaigrette over the couscous watermelon salad to dress it.
Garnish the salad with mint if you wish and serve either cold or at room temperature.
Making Greek Watermelon Salad With Orange Vinaigrette Cut the watermelon into cubes.
Wash the watermelon and cut it in half.
Cut away the rind of one half of the watermelon so you are left with the red fruit.
Then cut the fruit into 1 inch (2.54 cm) cubes.
Cut the feta cheese.
Take the block of feta cheese and dice it into pieces that are about ½ inch thick (1.27 cm).
You can also use feta cheese in large crumbles if you don’t have access to blocked feta cheese.
Make the vinaigrette.
Mix the orange juice and balsamic vinaigrette in a small salad dressing pitcher along with a pinch of salt and pepper.
Then add the olive oil and mix.
Mix the ingredients together.
Place the watermelon and feta cheese in a large bowl and mix.
Then pour on the vinaigrette over the salad and garnish with shredded mint leaves.
Serve the salad while cold.
Finished.
